sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词都有"坦率，诚实"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: frank, open, plain, blunt, honest, sincere, straightforward
means: frank ： 强调毫无保留地畅所欲言，不受任何约束。
open ： 指不隐瞒自己的秘密，愿意向他人表露自己或公开暴露自己的缺点。
plain ： 指直言不讳，毫不做作或故弄玄虚。
blunt ： 指讲话坦白直率、不客气，但隐含不得体、不顾及他人感情等意味。
honest ： 指遵守正直等道德准则。
sincere ： 侧重指一个人出自内心地对某人某事表示一种诚意。
straightforward ： 多用于答复、叙述等场合。指直截了当，不回避，或故弄玄虚。

sentence.Network_en: To be honest the house is not quite our style.
sentence.Network_cn: 说实话，这所房子不太适合我们。

sentence.Network_en: I want to be honest, honest above everything else.
sentence.Network_cn: 我想要做到诚实，一切以诚实为上。

sentence.Network_en: Fraudsters are often shopped by honest friends and neighbours.
sentence.Network_cn: 诈骗犯经常会被正直守法的朋友和邻居告发。

jx.jx_en_mean: (dated or humorous)marry a woman, especially to avoid scandal if she is pregnant
jx.jx_cn_mean: (旧或幽默)（尤指为避免使其怀孕引起的丑闻而）与一女子结婚

lj.lj_ly: to be honest, I expected to play worse.
lj.lj_ls: 说实话，我本来以为会打得 更糟。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (originally in the sense 'held in or deserving of honour'): via Old French from Latin honestus, from honos (see honour)

entry.def: If you describe someone as honest, you mean that they always tell the truth, and do not try to deceive people or break the law.

example.ex: My dad was the most honest man I ever met...
example.tran: 爸爸是我所见过的最正直的人。

example.ex: I know she's honest and reliable.

entry.tran: 坦诚的;直率的;不隐瞒真相的
entry.def: If you are honest in a particular situation, you tell the complete truth or give your sincere opinion, even if this is not very pleasant.

example.ex: I was honest about what I was doing...
example.tran: 我对自己所做的事情并无隐瞒。

example.ex: He had been honest with her and she had tricked him!...
example.tran: 他对她坦诚相见，而她却骗了他！

entry.def: You say 'honest' before or after a statement to emphasize that you are telling the truth and that you want people to believe you.

entry.tran: （表示强调）真的，实在，千真万确
entry.def: Some people say 'honest to God' to emphasize their feelings or to emphasize that something is really true.

example.ex: I wish we weren't doing this, Lillian, honest to God, I really do...
example.tran: 我希望我们没有在干这事，莉莲，真的，我真这么想。

example.ex: You wanna know the honest-to-God truth?
example.tran: 你想知道真正的事实吗？

entry.def: You can say 'to be honest' before or after a statement to indicate that you are telling the truth about your own opinions or feelings, especially if you think these will disappoint the person you are talking to.

example.ex: To be honest the house is not quite our style...
example.tran: 说实话，这所房子不太适合我们。

example.ex: I'd rather get it out the way, to be honest.
example.tran: 老实说，我情愿把它处理掉。

means.word_mean: 1. not disposed to cheat or defraud; not deceptive or fraudulent;

sentences.sentence: "I would be true for there are those who trust me"

list.explanation: 向(某人)提出要求或考验，使(某人)不能轻易过关

example.en: We'll ask her a few questions just to keep her honest.
example.zh: 我们要问她几个问题，只是考验考验她。

auth_sentence.content: But this remains a searingly honest and decisive collection.
auth_sentence.res_content: But this remains a searingly honest and decisive collection.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But this remains a searingly honest and decisive collection.

auth_sentence.content: To be honest, renewables are not risk free.
auth_sentence.res_content: To be honest, renewables are not risk free.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: To be honest, renewables are not risk free.

auth_sentence.content: This is just a theory and honest about it.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is just a theory and honest about it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is just a theory and honest about it.

stems_affixes.word_buile: hon=honor荣誉,光荣+est实质→adj.诚实的, 正直的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 可敬的, 荣誉的, 光荣的
stems_affixes.word_buile: honor荣誉,光荣+able……的→adj.可敬的, 荣誉的, 光荣的
honorable[adj.可敬的, 荣誉的, 光荣的]→adj.可敬的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 尊敬, 敬意, 荣誉, 光荣
stems_affixes.word_buile: honor荣誉,光荣→n.尊敬, 敬意, 荣誉, 光荣 v.尊敬, 给以荣誉
honor荣誉,光荣→n.尊敬, 敬意, 荣誉, 光荣 v.尊敬, 给以荣誉

Sentence.sentence: We must be honest about our actions and avoid excuses, if we fool ourselves into believing we're not doing anything wrong, we can't see the real choice we're making - and that leads to bad decisions.
Or you can be the honest type negotiator who's known to his partners in negotiation and always plays everything straight.
So really, you see two types of negotiator then, the actor or the honest one
I would say the honest negotiator can be quite effective in some circumstances.

means.word_mean: 诚实的, 正直的, 可靠的，老实的

sentences.en: An honest person has a lot of friends.

means.word_mean: 老实的, 真诚的，显示内心诚意的，表示态度诚恳的

sentences.en: He is honest in all he does.
sentences.cn: 他干什么都是老老实实的。

means.word_mean: 坦诚的, 直率的，坦率的

sentences.cn: 他有一张诚实坦率的脸。

sentences.en: You must be honest with me.
He was very honest to tell me his story.
sentences.cn: 他十分坦率地给我讲了他的故事。

sentences.en: He looked so honest that we accepted his story for true.
sentences.cn: 他看起来那么诚恳, 我们都把他的话当真了。

jushi.chinese: 他有一张诚实坦率的脸。
